bibl.title: Theocritus and the "Demythologizing" of Poetry.
bibl.note: See in part. pp. 136-142: the proem of Id. XVII (eulogy to Ptolemy) appears to have adopted as its model the first part of Simonides' elegy for the victory of the Greeks at Plataea, P. Oxy. XXII, 2327 (= Pack2 1750).

bibl.title: Matrices of Genre. Authors, Canons, and Society

bibl.seg: FANTUZZI Marco, Theocritus and the "Demythologizing" of Poetry.
Mary DEPEW and Dirk OBBINK (Edd.), Matrices of Genre. Authors, Canons, and Society = Center for Hellenic Studies Colloquia. 4 (Cambridge, Mass. - London, 2000) pp. 135-151; - 176-284.

See in part. pp. 136-142: the proem of Id. XVII (eulogy to Ptolemy) appears to have adopted as its model the first part of Simonides' elegy for the victory of the Greeks at Plataea, P. Oxy. XXII, 2327 (= Pack2 1750).
